website_summaries.verdict: A solid contender thanks to its performance and construction.
pros: Roomy and easy to close and clean
Insulation quality is comparable to that of pricier coolers
cons: A few users feel the shape is awkward
Occasional reports of quality issues with zipper and lining

website_summaries.verdict: A great alternative to traditional hard-sided coolers for consumers who prefer maneuverability over extended cold time.
pros: Soft-sided construction is lightweight yet durable
Thicker insulation compared to others in its class
Comes in 4 sizes and a variety of colors
cons: Thought it keeps ice for about 24 hours in extreme heat, this is less time that hard-sided models
Some reports of strap clip breakage

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cooler!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler kept a month's worth of my breast milk frozen during a move from the U.S. to South Africa which lasted about 3 days. I didn't lose any of the milk and I am so thankful for this cooler. Can't sing its praises enough!
customer_reviews.author: Dinah Zeltser

customer_reviews.title: Buy this you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome In the picture , I've got in my AO cooler: two 12 packs, a bottle of wine, and a 16 pound bag of ice. I use it more than I do my yeti cooler at a fraction of the cost
customer_reviews.author: Big Chief

customer_reviews.title: Terrible :/
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my boat. The first day I stuck a case of beer and a bag of ice inside. I picked it up and put the strap over my shoulder. It snapped. The ice melted around four hours later. Best part, I bought this product earlier in the year and haven’t used it until boating season. Now I’m out of return date.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The cooling capability seems fine. But for $60, I expected MUCH more from the bag! Haven't carried it ONCE! Packed it for a car trip, went to pick it up, and the buckle broke, detaching from itself and freeing the zipper track. Huge defect. Very unhappy. :(
customer_reviews.author: K. Gale

customer_reviews.title: Cosmetic flaws - questionable quality...
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, this soft cooler is very nice but then you start look it over and you see inconsistencies in the stitching, frayed handles, and seams that are uneven. Although it may be cosmetic, it makes you question the reliability of the cooler. Considering the price I expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy77379

customer_reviews.title: Beast Mode
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute beast. I have a couple of other coolers that I no longer use because, in my opinion, this is the best all-round cooler. I use it for going to the pool and carrying things to and from the grill (I live in an apartment). The AO cooler will retain ice for 2-3 days, even in the hot sun. I put two large Orca ice packs and some ice, and I am good to go. I went with the 36 can size. I'd say anything bigger would be too big for carrying. The one con I have is there isn't a lot of padding on the shoulder strap. That a pretty easy fix though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I started out really liking this cooler. Used it on a 90 degree beach for a week and it did retain the ice(with shock packs added) for entire day and no leaks. Unfortunately it has now started leaking somewhere through the bottom leaving the canvas wet. If you plan on primarily using shock packs I would recommend this cooler, but there may be some cheaper options available for that.
customer_reviews.author: D Lt

customer_reviews.title: soft side cooler
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this cooler for a 3 day road trip. This cooler was amazing. Kept things ice cold for an amazing amount of time. We did purchase some special "flash" freezer packs ... they stayed completely frozen for fully 48 hours. Amazing. It's soft sided, of course. I chose the blue. It's bright. The sizing is as represented in the ad. There is a should strap.. and handles, a zipper that is apparently strong. We've only used it the one time, and I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful. And I hope this info was helpful to you in some way.
customer_reviews.author: ForeverYOUNGTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Well insulated, flexible
customer_reviews.text: This is a well insulated cooler at a good price. It does a good job of balancing performance and price compared to high performance/expensive Orcas, Yetis, etc. and cheap soft coolers. I really like the top opening. It makes it very convenient to stash with the kids in the back seat during road trips. The zipper isn't water tight but we use cooler packs so that doesn't really matter. The lining is water tight. The zipper is easy to open and doesn't snag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is horrible. Do not order it. It does not hold ice. I bought in May and have tried to like it but I bought a bag of ice. Never stayed 24 hrs like they say it does. Melted!,!! ,
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn L. Green

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke 1 minutes after opening!
customer_reviews.text: Literally pulled it out of the wrapper and the shoulder strap clip broke when trying to remove it. Amazing for how highly these coolers are rated...
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Scot Smale

customer_reviews.title: This AO cooler really does keep ice solid for many ...
customer_reviews.text: This AO cooler really does keep ice solid for many hours providing enough cooling power even when fully packed. My only gripe is that one of the plastic buckles on the side of the cooler broke and cannot be fixed. This happened to the first AO cooler I purchased and the company replaced it free of charge. Now the replacement cooler has suffered the same fate. Otherwise I would have rated this cooler a full five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Russell P.

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler !!
customer_reviews.text: If you need a good cooler let me tell you this cooler is on its second beach trip and has been abused all year with golf tournaments etc and it still works awesome. We put a big frozen thing from dollar tree on each end fill the middle then put a gallon ziplock of ice on top. We are still using the same bag of ice we got Monday and last night I forgot to empty the cooler out and this morning ice and all was s frozen. It had melted a little but I drained the water off it and put it back in the freezer to use again!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Williamson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Purchase December 2016 was not used until summer 2017 and clip has already broken.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy this is to clean. I’ve used it on three road trips in AZ & CA now and it’s done a great job. More comfortable to carry than traditional coolers and much easier to squish lots of items into because it’s not hard plastic. I’ve had spills and melted ice that clean up incredibly fast. Can keep products cold through an entire day of driving.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooler, keeps things cold over 24 hours if ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooler, keeps things cold over 24 hours if not in direct sun. Con (which is outweighed by the pros) is that there is no way to easily empty out excess water as ice melts. The pro (and I think the reason the design is as it is) is that the bag is leak-proof (at least when right-side up) and the soft material allows for flexibility in transportation (and what seems like less total space). I'd rather its design than any cons that could be introduced by a break in the bag's seal (if there was a water spout for excess water). I've used this for grocery delivery, groceries, and for camping. Easy clean-up. Excellent bag. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Dose not stay cold very long.
customer_reviews.text: Very dissappointed. The reviews gave it rave reviews but my ice didnt even last 12 hours!! I tried it twice. Poor results each time.
customer_reviews.author: steven goodish

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Disappointed with this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the multiple reviews of how well it kept ice intact. We "loaded" the cooler with six bottles of water and 2-3 tupperware containers of sandwiches -- topped with 7 pounds of ice. We then we drove from St Louis to Austin in a very temperature controlled car, when we arrived we had very little ice left -- mainly just cold water in the cooler. I am really fearful of how this is going to perform when we use it during the hot midwest summers...I guess only time will tell !
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C.

customer_reviews.title: I love this cooler - we use it for camping and boating
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty surprised by this cooler. It keeps ice, doesn't leak, and keeps my drinks cold. The 48 can size is perfect for our family of 6. We put it on our boat and we have drinks cold all day. I was going to buy a cooler for $399 and decided to buy this one, and I don't regret it. Of course this will not keep ice for 2-3 days but it works for most of the day. Especially when we go boating the temperature is 110 degrees fahrenheit.
customer_reviews.author: Liz and Roger

customer_reviews.title: Well insulated and tough canvas shell.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 2 day truck driving runs. Keeps everything really cold. I have the 36 can cooler and have 6 plastic ice blocks that I bought at Walmart for $3 each. I cool the drinks down by leaving them in the refrigerator over night then surround 2 6-packs of my sodas and some extra waters....everything stays extremely cold for my 2 day trips. The ice blocks are still frozen when I return them to the deep freezer to refreeze.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great portable soft-side cooler, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Got this at Christmas time for my wife as she takes ice, snacks and drinks to work every day. She has been using it every day and loves it. Holding up well, looks like new after 3 months of daily use. Holds ice very well, still plenty left after 12 hours and the inside cleans easily. A very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Datindy

customer_reviews.title: You didn't really pay all that extra cash for a yeti. Did you?
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler at awesome price. We use this most weekends. We have left it in a vehicle overnite in a heatwave and still had ice chunks left over. We would definitely purchase another one to use for fresh caught fish, field dressed game, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Brammer

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler. Keeps ice fairly well.
customer_reviews.text: I scored the 36 can cooler here on Amazon for just $32. It seems as though that must have been an error, because it looks like they are normally a lot more. I do find the soft cooler with a shoulder strap a bit easier to lug around than a traditional roto molded cooler. You can get 2 days from your ice if you also use a Kooler Kube with your ice, but I absolutely will never believe that you can keep ice for 3 days. For $32 I think I got a deal, but if I paid the full price, I'd be a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Yeti Performance without Yeti price
customer_reviews.text: I own the Yeti hopper 20 which is what I compare all soft side coolers to. I bought this one because of the price, smaller size and good reviews. I can say the AO cooler performs as well as my Yeti. It will keep Ice from melting even on a hot day. It's great to take to kids sporting events events and road trips.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: DOESNT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Kept 12 beers, under the recommended FULL of ice in a closet in hotel room. temp didnt go above 72 degress. The cooler didnt even keep the ice for 12 hours. NO WAY it would do any better on a hot beach or boat. This is not worth ANY PENNY more than a cheap styrofoam cooler you buy at the grocery store. returning and never buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Adams

customer_reviews.title: Carry on for breastmilk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a carry on to travel with two weeks of frozen breastmilk. I had two ice packs and a piece of dry ice on the top and everything made it still frozen. I carried it through three airports with two long layovers without any problems. Freezer to freezer was about 20 hours and everything was completely solid. I was very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Garaas

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler!
customer_reviews.text: We took this cooler on our canoeing trip and it was great! Kept our drinks and sandwiches cold. Our ice did melt a good bit, but we didn’t cool the bag before we used it, like recommended. Still, no complaints because we just needed it for several hours. It’s a great cooler with an even better price!
customer_reviews.author: K.Rich

customer_reviews.title: Best value cooler hands down!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this cooler for years now and it is the best cooler! We have several yeti’s and other high dollar coolers and this one is a quarter the cost and works just as well! We use this on our trips to Disney and even in the Florida heat and being at the parks all day we still have ice and cold drinks when we get back! It’s been on several trips to Disney, countless softball tournaments, camping trips and it’s still just as good as it was. The ONLY and I mean only downside to this cooler is it does sometimes leak. Minor flaw compared to how great it holds ice.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Marlow

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is amazing. It is small/ compact and keeps ice cool much longer than a traditional cooler of similar size. I use it in my car that has very little room to spare. It fits anywhere and easily transports. I think because the cooler somewhat collapses on the inside it insulates directly. It keeps beverages very cool. I no longer have to carry around a bigger ice chest. It is a little tough to dump ice cubes into the top, but it does not bother me, it does not offset the benefits of this cooler. if you use cold packs it is even better. I cannot say enough about this cooler. Thanks for creating a valuable product!
customer_reviews.author: Theotherone

customer_reviews.title: Great trip cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item to use on motorcycle trips to keep drinks, food and cooling items cold for those hot days on the bike. My friend had a 24 can size one that she used last year on a trip....the ice never melted and her stuff stayed very cold. My ice melted within an hour in the cooler I was using. Look forward to using this one this year on our next long trip.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Kept Ice for just a few hours
customer_reviews.text: It woks as a carry on under the seat. It kept ice for less than 12 hours and it was never in the sun but in an air conditioned room. Our cheap coolers can do that. Disappointed in that fact. We needed to use it as with ice! The good point is ... it didn’t leak
customer_reviews.author: Jana Boettger

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler
customer_reviews.text: Use this for umpiring baseball in the summer here in Alabama. Keep about 8 waters and a couple of poweraids and they stay cold all day. Sturdy construction and easy to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: aaluck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had this cooler for a year. I am extremely impressed with it's quality. Shortly after buying this cooler I purchased a second smaller one. Both are holding up perfectly. They don't leak at all. Keep my stuff really cold. All the seams and handles are very well secured and I'm not getting any tears, not even stretching. I feel like they are fairly priced for the high quality product it is and wish more manufacturers produced products of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your drinks, etc COLD!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this cooler for 3 mo TBA now, and it is GREAT! I use it with Cooler Shock ice substitute packs, and it keeps my drinks VERY cold, even on 100°+F days. I do t know how it would perform with other brand cooling packs. I will say that you can get more canned drinks than bottled drinks in the cooler because you can stack them more efficiently. I’m very satisfied with its performance, and would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: fern281

customer_reviews.title: multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: I use it to to safely transport my underwater camera and strobes.
customer_reviews.author: John Augsbury

customer_reviews.title: Not Good Big Diasappoint.
customer_reviews.text: Ice melts within 5 hrs in 80 degree weather. Left ice in the bag overnight in house ~ all water in morning . I’ve tried different purchased ice as well as home ice stills melts. Tried chilling bag as suggested still melts ice. Definitely will not work on a beach as planned. I guess a received s reject ~ expensive reject at that. Save your money. On only positive note camouflage color is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Lea

customer_reviews.title: Our experience has been very positive
customer_reviews.text: We were making a 58 hour trip from southern Florida to eastern Massachusetts. Loaded it solidly with refrigerated food, a few blocks of frozen stuff that we were prepared to have arrive defrosted, and a half-dozen freezer blocks. Tried to eliminate all air pockets. Never took it out of the car, so it spent the two nights in the mid-lower 40's. Arrived with everything suitably cool and nothing spoiled.
customer_reviews.author: Martha's Vineyard

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: So not a waterproof zipper. And the small zipper makes it hard to pull closed when stuffs in it. The zipper could definitely be upgraded to a heavy duty on. When this beast is packed it’s heavy and hard to carry with just the strap. Side handles would be a welcome addition. We have a few other AO’s and they get the job done and have good customer service if you need it but the design features are ready for an upgrade
customer_reviews.author: stacii

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this cooler to transport and keep medicine cold during a recent weeklong trip. It survived two plane rides, eight days of getting on and off a tour bus, and five hotels. In the morning we'd load it with ice. In the evening the majority of ice was still frozen. The only reason it didn't receive five stars for leak proof is that you must fold and secure the both ends of the zipper after closing it.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Husband

customer_reviews.title: Ice Ice Baby
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is amazing, said it would keep my ice frozen and it did. We have a hot rod and every cooler I've bought my ice is usually gone in a few hours. Not this one, I actually had ice last till the next day. We left Omaha headed to Colorado on a nice hot 100* day filled the cooler and took off arrived 8+ hours later to have ice cold soda and water. Recommend this to anyone in a hot rod or motor cycle. The sides fold down and latch which was a plus as we have space issues in a Model A.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Lee

customer_reviews.title: I do love the material it is made in because I use ...
customer_reviews.text: The description states that it holds ice for 24 hours in 120 degree heat....I've used this several times in 110-115 heat and the ice is melted within 7 to 10 hours. It's not in direct sunlight or anything so I don't really understand how it melts so fast. :( BUT, I do love the material it is made in because I use it in my boat and I have brand new upholstery so this is great and doesn't scratch it and it fits nicely behind the seats.
customer_reviews.author: Heitec Consulting

customer_reviews.title: Kept drinks cold
customer_reviews.text: One bag of ice and mostly out of direct sun and was able to keep canned beverages cold for 3+ days. Ice was intact for 1+days. Build quality is pretty good. Overall happy enough with this as a soft cooler. I don't regret not getting the much more expensive Yeti bag.
customer_reviews.author: PublicName

customer_reviews.title: Best Cooler Bag Ever!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Florida and my husband drives a mail delivery truck. We put a thermometer in his delivery vehicle for a few weeks, and daily it hits 115-125 degrees. He carries the bag with him and for the first time in more than 25 yrs he has cold drinks throughout the entire day and still has ice in the bag at the end of the day!!! Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette S.

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cooler because we live out in the country and need to keep things cold on the drive home. So far this seems to to the job very well. I wasn't looking for something that would hold ice for days, so I'm wasn't concerned about the comments concerning that aspect. If you want to keep ice for days at a time fork out the big bucks for a Yeti (or equivalent). For quick trips this works well.
customer_reviews.author: G. Raney

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and large capacity.
customer_reviews.text: This has become my go-to car travel cooler, replacing a rigid, plug-in unit that failed after a couple years. I expect this to last much longer. Plus, with a few ice packs, it keeps things colder and is much easier to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: tsaro

customer_reviews.title: A COOLER THAT DOES WHAT IT SAYS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take on road trips, it's small enough that it stores in the vehicle easily but big enough to carry 8 water bottles a few snacks or couple sandwiches and 5+ pounds of ice. I have used it a few times and each time the outdoor temp has been in the 80's, I leave it in the cab of the truck all day and night as well and the next morning it still has about half the ice. Plus being its not made of plastic it does not rattle or squeak and that's priceless when driving.
customer_reviews.author: WoodButcher

customer_reviews.title: No leaks
customer_reviews.text: Took this in a Jeep on a week-long National Parks trip in Colorado this summer. Temps weren't high but we wanted to keep plenty of cold water on hand, as well as a couple of picnic lunches. Although it advertises that it will hold ice for two full days, we found that it was melted after one. (It was at least still cold.) The thing I like most is that it didn't leak one drop. Worth the price we got it for, compared to the way pricier competitors.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler lovingly dubbed the 'poor man's YETI'
customer_reviews.text: Used this cooler over a couple of summers now. It holds ice well and has not leaked yet. What I like: - Cheap - Well insulated - Holds a surprising amount What I don't like: - Straps are unpadded and can be uncomfortable when carrying a load of cans - The zips are not air tight water proof zips like you would find on a YETI
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great buy. Because of the performance of this size
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a weekend getwaway to some national parks. While it wasn't too hot outside, this cooler sat in the car on some sunny days. And with a black interior it gets hot. However, at the end of some very long days, the ice packs were still frozen, the water bottles were still cold, and the refillable water bottles still had ice in them. Overall a great buy. Because of the performance of this size, I bought the 24 can size as soon as I got home.
customer_reviews.author: RahRahRah

customer_reviews.title: Good item for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the large 24pk cooler and it does the job took to beach and ice lasted all day. Not 3 days like some reviews but hey it does a good job. The design is nice sand does not stick to it so easy to wipe off. Wish I had gotten the smaller version also but overall really like this cooler for the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler exceeded my expectations. Normally when you have a soft sided cooler they do not do a good job of retaining ice. This cooler has exceeded my expectations and would rank it similar to a hard sided cooler
customer_reviews.author: MigsNSX

customer_reviews.title: Great soft-sided cooler
customer_reviews.text: I bought the smallest size of this cooler, big enough to take 12 cans of cold beer to my softball league night games. It works as promised -- I have used ice and also those blue freezer cold packs. Works great and it's a lot more comfortable to carry than my hard cooler case. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Owens

customer_reviews.title: Wear and Tear already?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because my friends have owned them with success. I have only used the bag less then 5 times camping and the corners are already worn through the canvas and almost through the insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler.....
customer_reviews.text: I took it to Mexico and loaded it with fillets, no leaks, no stress, no tears. It folds up flat, albeit still a little bulky, but for what it does, it is fantastic. Used for a local fishing trip, loaded it with fish, it stunk, but cleaned up easily. I highly recommend this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: atgreek

customer_reviews.title: Good Cooler with no leaks
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler. Bought the softsided cooler to be able to pack it in luggage when flying to camping vacations. The cooler held ice for at least 36 hours in 70 degree range ambient temperatures. This cooler did not leak when filled 3/4 full with melt water, except thru the zipper when tipped. It is bulky due to the thick foam insulation. It did not compress as flat as I wanted in the luggage but it did fit in the bottom comparment of a rolling duffle bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought the perfect size, keeps everything cold, does not leak and is offered at a great price. Why bother with a Yeti when you can purchase this at a quarter of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps cold for 2 days or so
customer_reviews.text: I've had this cooler for about half a midwest summer and used it once or twice weekly. One particular sunny day it was left in my friends' car on a 90-degree day (windows closed) for about 6 hours. I figured my beer would be warm when we got back to the car, but NO. It was still cold! I've also had several people ask me what brand it is, where did I get it... It's a very handsome cooler (wierd to say I know).
customer_reviews.author: M. Norman

customer_reviews.title: Wow this thing is bad ass. I've been looking for a Yeti
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing is bad ass. I've been looking for a Yeti, but can't afford their $300 price tags. This cooler is HUGE. I stocked it with a dozen oysters, two growlers and dining utensils for a long kayak ride. 3 hours later in 90 degree heat, the ice was about 20% melted. I contribute that to not packing bottom, top and sides with full ice coverage. For another test run, I literally just left a cup of ice with a cupcake in my car for 4 hours. The ice held firm!
customer_reviews.author: Barty Mcgee

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have recently used this cooler on a long road trip and it worked flawlessly. Kept everything cold and when this cooler was filled with ice it wasn't difficult to carry around. It's very durable and sturdy. While carrying it over the shoulder the strap had sufficient padding and while carrying with the carrying handles the bag held up. I would definitely buy this again and from what I hear about the manufacturer is that they stand by their product if there is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband, who owns multiple Yeti coolers, and this is his cooler of choice. It is easy to carry, keeps ice for days, and the straps are very comfortable. The zipper also doesn't eat your hand off when you use it (Yeti soft side owners know what I am talking about). As an added plus, my husband also used this as a carry on for a tropical vacation and it fit perfectly under the seat on the plane. It was very versatile to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cooler. I live in South Carolina
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cooler. I live in South Carolina. It's hot as Satan's front porch here and I have been looking for a soft sided cooler that keeps everything cold and does not leak/sweat. I found it with the AO Cooler. I've used it at the beach several times - from 9:00am until 4:00pm in the hot sun. It did not leak or sweat. I still had ice when I returned home. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: jknight

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler there is
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cooler to use every day take bottles of water to work. I tried another brand name and with two ice packs, ice was melted by noon and water warm by 2pm. With is this cooler. two ice packs and 3 bottles of chilled water stay frigid cold all day. Construction is great. I am looking at the bigger ones for other uses. Thanks for the great product at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Hinnenkamp

customer_reviews.title: Well made - too much cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a replacement for a soft sided cooler we have used for years. Thought this would work, but was just too much cooler for our needs. The thick insulated walls took up too much room and the cooler wasn't as flexible (because of the thick insulation). Nice cooler, but not for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: GammaT

customer_reviews.title: Cold beer all day long!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler has met all expectations. I have had it keep beer and other foods cold for the entire day and more on the lake. Go out in the morning come back in the evening with very little melt and lots of ice remains. I did spray it with scotchguard as it would be exposed to external water which helps keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It leaks and sweated through the fabric on first time used
customer_reviews.author: Pvet

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Definitely served it's purpose. Kept items cool and cold. Looks great. Has multi straps to either carry or shoulder. Easy to clean if needed. Will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler. We packed it for a 3 day boat trip along the South Carolina coast in July. It was hot and humid, as expected. With the soft sides, it travels well and is easy to carry with the shoulder strap. We replenished the ice late in the second day. Impressed with the lining. It performed very well in keeping it's contents cold. I don't want to spend a lot of money for a cooler that can keep its contents cold for a week. I just needed a few days of cooling. This item did its job.
customer_reviews.author: J. McGee

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality!
customer_reviews.text: I use this coolor bag to store and keep my breast milk frozen when I travel internationally, for long trips. This bag has been a life saver, it is leakproof and will keep the ice cold! It is sturdy and not soo big, so I can actually carry this around without a problem (im very petite).
customer_reviews.author: carolyf

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you'll like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and it's worth the money. I purchased the 24 pack and it has plenty of room and keeps items cold for a few days without re-filling the ice. Heavy duty canvas, has thick insulation inside and nice handle and straps. Left out in the sun for hours and it did not sweat or leak. I like that the sides buckle down (read directions). Used 4 times so far and its works better than any of the other soft cooler I have purchased. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Island

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for price
customer_reviews.text: For a cheap one it’s not bad. You get a little too much water condensation on he outside and bottom of the bag for me. Brought it to the beach and it worked just fine. It’s not going to save you ice really but you’ll keep beer cold all day on the beach
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Looks Durable Enough for a Camping Trip
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Its huge! Had to return it because it was too big for what I would be using it for, but I would highly recommend this product to others as it looks like it is built to last. If you need a cooler for a camping trip that is easy to carry this is your cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen K.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I got a bad cooler or it just isn't as great as the ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased cooler hoping it would hold ice for at least the 24 hours it stated it would even though multiple reviews indicated it would hold ice longer. First time I used it I packed it around 7 in the morning and by noon nearly all the ice was melted. The drinks I put into the cooler were already cold and the cooler was outside in 70-75 degree temperatures. Not sure if I got a bad cooler or it just isn't as great as the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great golf cooler
customer_reviews.text: Got this for golf. Fits perfectly in the carts basket. Holds more than enough for a round of golf. Keeps everything cold the entire day in summer weather. Not going to compete with other more expensive brands on length of time to keep things cold, but more than sufficient for a day.
customer_reviews.author: RIPT

customer_reviews.title: Completely happy, as it went on a 3
customer_reviews.text: Completely happy, as it went on a 3,000 mile road trip. Fit in my car nicely, easy to access. I like using ice packs and frozen water bottles, and they seemed to stay solid, long enough to recharge between stops. Used ice once, OK, but really heavy. Well constructed, but I see why they don't recommend bottles as anything sharp could rip the loose liner.
customer_reviews.author: ASH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. This I bought to carry mothers milk for ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. This I bought to carry mothers milk for a 24 hours flight journey (Total 45 Lansinoh Milk Storage Bags ). Most important thing is, milk should be frozen all the time during the journey and this bag is on top of it . Total journey was 29 hours Along with this bag, I bought "4 Mid Size Cooler Shock Freeze Packs 10"x 9" - No More Ice! Reusable" and this is pretty good kept milk bags frozen.
customer_reviews.author: cherry

customer_reviews.title: As good as the reviews say it is
customer_reviews.text: As good as the reviews say it is. I've used this cooler on many hard hunts. From freezing temps to over 100. It's a brute. It's now part of my essential tools for camping, hunting and barbeque outings. It's nice to see products that over-perform for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: A. Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler bag. Use it when grocery shopping, so I do not have to make many trips back to house, since I live in South Florida. I put 2 cooler shocks in bag, which make inside bag like a refrigerator and I don't have to worry about my food for many hours. This is my 3rd bag, also look into Polar Bear Cooler Bags, You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Flig

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: while not quite a Yeti, you can buy 5 of these guys for the same price. Used it to transport frozen fish fillets on planes as carry-on. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: mikasavaii

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight cooler that holds ice well
customer_reviews.text: Nice light weight cooler that holds ice for a long time. Color and zipper are nice but I was a little disappointed in the durability. After carrying this cooler to the beach 2-3 times the shoulder pad ripped on the strap and the cooler became very uncomfortable to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, Light and Well-Made
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, maintains cold temperature, light weight.seems very well made. Had an Arctic Zone cooler (~9.5 x 18 x 11) for 20 years that was fantastic until the zipper broke. They don't make this now and those they do make are way inferior in quality to the old ones. This AO Cooler was the only thing comparable to my old cooler that was within my price range. I am extremely pleased with it. I have the 48-pack in gray canvas.
customer_reviews.author: Mars99

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME COOLER QUARTER THE COST!
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive about buying this but $300.00 for the Yeti was just way too much, I ran a test, I put 12 waters and one eight pound bag of ice when cooler and drinks were all at room temperature. I left the cooler with the drinks and ice in it in the back of my Jeep Cherokee and after 24 hours drinks were still cold (still little bit of ice remaining). This was in close to 100 degree temps in full sunlight. If you want the hype buy Yeti, if you want the same performance buy AO!
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great for grocery trips and any place you need to keep drinks cold
customer_reviews.text: I am now using this for trips from the grocery store and to take drinks to a friends house. It keeps ice for about a day or so. Used it on a cruise to buy a bucket of beer (buy 5 and get one free) and save on beer costs.
customer_reviews.author: dave schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great soft cooler!
customer_reviews.text: The cooler is much larger than I had mentally pictured. But it sat nicely in the foot well of my front seat. Ice lasted all three days of my travel and it took very little additional ice to keep it cool in 95+ temps in Ohio. I am very pleased with the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good design, so so ice retention
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design and the way it works. I would say that it does pretty well with ice retention, but not great. The 24 can cooler is plenty big for 24 cans an a lot of ice (I crammed almost 20 lbs of ice in after 24 cans).
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I hate this cooler. Not happy when I saw that you had to chill the interior 5 hrs before using. Kind of inconvenient to get a few bags of ice to fill it. I did that and I might as well purchased a plastic bag to use. Chilled it overnight - loaded it with frozen fish and more ice before traveling. It was unopened for 24 hrs. When I reached my destination the fish was only half frozen. The upside? It’s a cool looking bag, but not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: BETTY P

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Big Abe roomy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooler! Well made and large. Kept drinks cold enough. I used frozen bottle water instead of ice so no leaking water. After several days water was still icy
customer_reviews.author: Robin A.

customer_reviews.title: works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: took it to the Florida beach. filled it with cold food and beverages and added ice. kept it in the shade and it lasted all day and still had a lot of ice the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Skillit Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome soft sided cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome soft sided cooler! It stores an 18 pack of 12 oz beer with a bag of ice. The ice will last all day if not longer even on a hot day. We have yet to experience any leaks and we've had it for an entire golf season being shoved into the basket of a golf cart. Well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and keeps ice as marketed
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a 4 star as it compares to my Polar Bear Cooler that I bought at the same time. The straps on the AO cooler are not as expandable as compared to the Polar Bear's, which is advertised as the same size but are not really the same.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne DeYoung

customer_reviews.title: Awesome extremely high quality lunch bag
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this after seeing a set of AO Coolers that a client owned. These coolers are very high quality. The problems I've had with other coolers is that the liner will tear or leak after a short period of time. The liner on this is extremely thick and the outside nylon fabric is also very sturdy. It's more expensive than the coolers that can be purchased at most stores but the quality is so much better. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Duane E. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great for bringing cold food and drinks to the boat
customer_reviews.text: Love this soft-sided cooler. Have had it more than a year and it still works fine. Keeps food and drinks plenty cold. Doesn't leak. I only wish it were a little easier to clean ... sometimes spills leave a stain inside.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and pull the trigger.....great buy alert!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It came highly recommended by my coworkers who use it often and frequently. This is perfect for golf outings, family outings to the park, and any other outdoor event. It holds way more than 12 cans including a significant amount of ice. Save your hard earned money and buy this soft sided cooler versus the name brand coolers. The only difference between this and the competitors is the zipper. Otherwise the engineering is the same. Pull the trigger on this one!
customer_reviews.author: J. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Works very well with Cooler Shock gel packs.  Small size is perfect for 1-2 people.
customer_reviews.text: Was just incredible at the beach. I shoved two Cooler Shock packs in the sides and 6-7 drinks were icy cold all day long. For 1 - 2 people this is a great size. I'd go with the larger size if you're hauling drinks and ice packs for more folks than that.
customer_reviews.author: E. in VA

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: As far as coolers go, I'm sure this one is functional. The reason I gave it 3 stars is because it really didn't look like the picture. It's shape is more of a satchel shape. I also did not like the side straps.
customer_reviews.author: TomG

customer_reviews.title: Well made bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought for going out on UTV. Seems well built, well insulated, have only used it twice so cant really say how well it will hold up with continued use. Holds a 30pk and 20lbs of ice if anyone is concerned about space
customer_reviews.author: boater

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cooler
customer_reviews.text: I looked up the top 10 coolers on google. This one is the perfect size for me. Small, holds several 16oz water bottles and a few soda cans. No leaks or sweating at all. Fits loaded into a storage compartment on my bass boat. Rather than using ice I bought 3 blue ice for chilling. Keeps drinks cold up to 24 hrs. Cold enough to burn after all day in a hot compartment. Great cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler. Great price. Good seller. Fast shipping. Have bought a few of these coolers and they are the best coolers in the world. I highly suggest this product if you’re looking for quality. A+++
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Inner plastic lining deteriorated after 6 uses!
customer_reviews.text: Opted to follow that advice of WireCutter to get the cheaper version of the polar soft cooler for our summer picnics. Seems to only keep ice solid for 3-4 hours. After 6 uses, and through cleaning and drying after each use, the inner plastic lining developed mildew and has started to disintegrate all along the zipper. What a piece of garbage! Will spend more money on the more durable Polar and Yeti coolers in future. Update: Was given a full refund by Amazon for this defective item.
customer_reviews.author: Madalyn B Summers

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler, lightweight and helped on my tropical sailing charters
customer_reviews.text: Love love love our AO cooler. Utilized it sailing and had it packed with 50# of frozen food for days on my sailing in the BVIs. Checked as a bag on airliners without problems
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I like this cooler a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this cooler a lot. It can fit 18 cans, a few bottles of water and most of a 10lb bag of ice. Holds the ice way better than my previous soft sided cooler. Even on 100 degree days there is still plenty of ice after 8-10 hours of fishing and being opened probably 20 times.
customer_reviews.author: RTC

product_meta.title: AO Coolers Original Soft Cooler with High-Density Insulation
product_meta.description: Use for picnics, hold your binoculars, camera, lunch bag and daytrips. Bringing an item for dinner or a potlock? Use this cooler to keep things warm as well. Features: Removable Shoulder Strap Twice the insulation as other soft-sided coolers Holds ice about twice as long as other soft-sided coolers Leak-Proof Liner A side pocket for dry items Specifications: Dimensions: 14" length x7" width x12" height Logo Area: 5"x8" Capacity: 12 cans plus 5 pounds of ice
feature_bullets: Soft-sided cooler with removable shoulder strap
Guaranteed to hold ice for 24 hours in 120 degree weather; 12-can capacity.Product Dimensions: 14 x 7 x 12 inches
Perfect for boating, fishing, hunting, parties, sporting events, and picnics
Features a side pocket for dry items
Twice the insulation of other soft-sided coolers; leak-proof liner

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
